context: Act 2B Chapter 2.2 — Underground international racers arrive. Japanese touge specialists, European circuit pros. Bigger stage.

lines.text: The container yard near Pier 9. Midnight. But tonight is different — the yard is full. Not the usual twenty or thirty cars. Hundreds. From license plates you recognize and ones you don't. Japanese plates. German plates. Australian plates.
The International Underground Circuit has come to Nova Pacifica.

lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: Once a year, the best underground drivers in the world converge on a host city. This year, it's us. Six races over two weeks. No rules except the code.

lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: These aren't amateurs. The Japanese contingent — touge specialists from Hakone and Irohazaka. They grew up on mountain passes that make our hillside look like a parking lot.

lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: The Europeans — circuit racers from the Autobahn underground. They've been racing at two hundred plus on roads that were never designed for it. Their car control is surgical.

lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: And the Australians — outback rally specialists. They can drive sideways at a hundred and fifty and consider it Tuesday.
A woman approaches. Japanese. Early twenties. She moves like a cat — every step deliberate, every muscle aware. Her eyes evaluate you with the clinical precision of a surgeon.

lines.speaker: Yuki Tanaka
lines.text: You are the one they call the Underground King of Nova Pacifica. I expected someone... bigger.

choices.text: Size doesn't matter on the road. Driving does.
The roads here are tighter than they look. Don't underestimate them.

lines.label: yuki_impressed
lines.speaker: Yuki Tanaka
lines.text: Good answer. In Japan, we say 'the wind does not show its face.' I am Yuki Tanaka. Hakone touge champion. Three years undefeated.

lines.label: yuki_introduces
lines.speaker: Yuki Tanaka
lines.text: Yuki Tanaka. Hakone touge circuit. I have raced on mountains that would make your harbor run look like a children's ride. But I respect any road that has history.

lines.label: yuki_acknowledges
lines.speaker: Yuki Tanaka
lines.text: I never underestimate a road. Roads have memory. They remember every driver who has respected them — and every driver who hasn't.

lines.label: european_arrival
lines.text: A broad-shouldered man with a thick German accent approaches. He carries himself like a man who has driven faster than most people will ever travel in their lives.

lines.speaker: Klaus Werner
lines.text: Klaus Werner. Autobahn underground. I've heard about Nova Pacifica. Tight roads, heavy traffic, lots of drama. In Germany, we prefer our racing clean. Fast, straight, pure.

lines.speaker: Klaus Werner
lines.text: But I can adapt. The question is whether your city can handle what we bring.

lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: It can. It has. For thirty years.

The tension between the locals and the internationals is a living thing. Not hostility — respect stretched to its limits. Every driver here believes they are the best. Only the road will decide who's right.

lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: Six races. Different circuits. Different conditions. The driver with the most points at the end takes the International Crown. Nova Pacifica has never won it — our best was second, fifteen years ago.

lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: The city needs this. The underground needs this. Win the International Crown and every circuit in Nova Pacifica is united under one banner. Lose and the international crews will run our roads for the next year — their rules, their way.

choices.text: I'll bring the Crown home. For Nova Pacifica.
This is the biggest stage I've ever been on. I'm ready.

lines.label: diesel_proud
lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: That's what I needed to hear. Not for the trophy. For the city. For the underground. For everyone who races in the dark because the light doesn't have room for them.

lines.label: diesel_nods
lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: Good. Because ready is the minimum. This field will test everything I've taught you — and everything you've taught yourself.

lines.label: intl_end
lines.text: The container yard buzzes with engines from three continents. Music plays from different cars — J-pop, electronic, Australian rock — and the night air carries the universal language of exhaust and anticipation.
Tomorrow, the International Underground Circuit begins. The world's best underground drivers on Nova Pacifica's roads. Your roads.
It is going to be magnificent.
